The focus is solely on the Pringles can and the chip she is about to eat. Given this information, the only distinct food item being handled or consumed is the Pringles Paprika chips. <think>
At  [1-7], the little girl is seen eating Pringles Paprika chips. She is offered a slice of watermelon but pushes it away, continuing to eat the chips. A hand then takes the can of chips away from her. The scene transitions to a young woman holding the same can of Pringles Paprika chips. She shakes her head and pours out the chips. 

Earlier, at [0-1], the little girl was holding and about to eat the Pringles Paprika chips. This confirms that the Pringles Paprika chips are one distinct food item being handled and consumed. The watermelon slice offered to the girl introduces a second distinct food item, even though she doesn't consume it. 

The young woman later handles the Pringles Paprika chips, but no additional food items are introduced. Therefore, two distinct food items are involved: Pringles Paprika chips and watermelon. 

Option C, which states Two distinct food items are handled or consumed,is the most accurate choice.
</think>
